      • getRegex

        public java.lang.String getRegex()
        Description copied from interface: URITemplate.FieldHandler
        return a regular expression that matches valid field entries. ".*" can be used to match anything, but this limits use. TODO: where is this used? I added it because it's easy and I saw a TODO to add it.
        Specified by:
        getRegex in interface URITemplate.FieldHandler
        Returns:
        null to match anything, or a regular expression matching valid entries.

      • parse

        public void parse(java.lang.String fieldContent,
                  int[] startTime,
                  int[] timeWidth,
                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> extra)
           throws java.text.ParseException
        Description copied from interface: URITemplate.FieldHandler
        parse the field to interpret as a time range.
        Specified by:
        parse in interface URITemplate.FieldHandler
        Parameters:
        fieldContent - the field to parse, for example "2014" for $Y
        startTime - the current startTime
        timeWidth - the current timeWidth
        extra - extra data, such as version numbers, are passed out here.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - when the field is not consistent with the spec.

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(int[] startTime,
                               int[] timeWidth,
                               int length,
                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> extra)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: URITemplate.FieldHandler
        create a string given the times, when this is possible. An IllegalArgumentException should be thrown when this is not possible, but be loose so this can be composed with other field handlers. For example, imagine the $Y field handler. This should not throw an exception when 2012-03-29 is passed in because it's not 2012-01-01, because the $m and $d might be used later. However if a time is specified for a year before the first orbit of a spacecraft, then an exception should be thrown because there is an error that the developer is going to have to deal with.
        Specified by:
        format in interface URITemplate.FieldHandler
        Parameters:
        startTime - the startTime in [ Y, m, d, H, M, S, nanoseconds ]
        timeWidth - the width in [ Y, m, d, H, M, S, nanoseconds ]
        extra - extra data, such as version numbers, are passed in here.
        Returns:
        the string representing the time range specified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the arguments passed in are not sufficient.
